column2: Name of GPT-3 neural network layer
column4: Description of its function in the neural network as a whole
Converts input tokens into continuous vectors and incorporates positional encoding to maintain information about the relative positions of tokens in the input sequence.

Processes input token representations through self-attention mechanisms and feed-forward neural networks, capturing relationships between tokens, learning syntactic and semantic information, and refining token representations.
Generates predictions by converting processed token representations back into a probability distribution over the vocabulary, selecting the token with the highest probability as the prediction.
